declarations.comments: Supply a single input to the indexed queue.
declarations.title: put

declarations.comments: Application policy is such that the inputs are stored in the named handler's "pending" values,
declarations.title: putMany

declarations.comments: Application policy is such that the inputs will be applied uniformly to all handlers, sorted by
declarations.title: broadcastManyExcept

declarations.comments: Application policy is such that the globally pending inputs will be extracted and applied
declarations.title: on

declarations.comments: Removes only the globally pending inputs
declarations.title: takeBroadcast

declarations.comments: Removes locally pending inputs for a specific key
declarations.title: take

declarations.comments: Unregisters a handler, returns whether one existed
declarations.title: del

declarations.comments: Removes all handlers, but preserves pending data
declarations.title: clear

declarations.comments: Applies a nullary named handler, to remove any globally pending data
declarations.title: drain

declarations.comments: Invoke the queue in `Aff`
declarations.title: callAsync

declarations.comments: Invoke the queue in `Eff`
declarations.title: callAsyncEff

declarations.comments: For binding the receiver
declarations.title: registerSync

declarations.comments: Bind a receiver only once
declarations.title: registerSyncOnce

modules.name: Queue
modules.comments:
Un-indexed queues with a set of handlers - this is useful for sending messages to a set of recipients,
where removing them individually from the queue isn't necessary (but incremental additions are). This
could be useful in interfaces where the list of handlers strictly increases, then gets wiped all at
once if desired (i.e. a feed of social media posts).

declarations.comments: Supply a single input to the queue.
declarations.title: put

declarations.comments: Supply many inputs in batch to the queue.
declarations.title: putMany

declarations.comments: Add a handler to the unindexed queue.
declarations.title: on

declarations.comments: Treat this as the only handler, and on the next input, clear all handlers.
declarations.title: once

declarations.comments: Pull the next asynchronous value out of a queue. Doesn't affect existing handlers (they will all receive the value as well).
declarations.title: draw

declarations.comments: Read all pending values (if any), without removing them from the queue.
declarations.title: read

declarations.comments: Take all pending values (if any) from the queue.
declarations.title: take

declarations.comments: Removes the registered callbacks, if any.
declarations.title: del

declarations.comments: Adds a listener that does nothing, and "drains" any pending messages.
declarations.title: drain

declarations.comments: Invoke the queue in `Aff`
declarations.title: callAsync

declarations.comments: Invoke the queue in `Eff`
declarations.title: callAsyncEff

declarations.comments: For binding the receiver
declarations.title: registerSync

declarations.comments: Bind a receiver only once
declarations.title: registerSyncOnce

modules.name: Queue.One
modules.comments:
Queues with at most one handler - this is useful for sending messages to a single, solitary
handler (user interface component, websocket connection, what have you).

declarations.comments: Supply a single input to the queue.
declarations.title: put

declarations.comments: Supply many inputs in batch to the queue.
declarations.title: putMany

declarations.comments: Assign the handler to the singleton queue.
declarations.title: on

declarations.comments: Run the handler only once for the next input before unassigning itself.
declarations.title: once

declarations.comments: Pull a single asynchronous value out of a queue.
declarations.title: draw

declarations.comments: Take all pending values (if any) from the queue.
declarations.title: take

declarations.comments: Read all pending values (if any), without removing them from the queue.
declarations.title: read

declarations.comments: Removes the registered callbacks, if any.
declarations.title: del

declarations.comments: Adds a listener that does nothing, and "drains" any pending messages.
declarations.title: drain

declarations.comments: Invoke the queue in `Aff`
declarations.title: callAsync

declarations.comments: Invoke the queue in `Effect`
declarations.title: callAsyncEff

declarations.comments: For binding the receiver
declarations.title: registerSync

declarations.comments: Bind a receiver only once
declarations.title: registerSyncOnce
